attributes.action: Review the conditions of the Licensing Act 2003 to exclude 'casual' public performances that are secondary to the principle activity of the artist
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The terms of the 'Licensing Act 2003' have been found to inhibit the good humour, best intentions and public spirited nature of persons who would wish to deliver public performances secondary to their principle activity.

Case in point: The proprietor of a sandwich shop in Burton Upon Trent has been advised that he must not continue to carry out public performances in his shop without purchasing a license. The ‘performances’ which are the subject of this debate consist of the said gentleman merely singing to himself as he goes about his work – making sandwiches and serving his customers.

The essence of this petition is to bring to the attention of the Prime Minister this further example of how modern legislation and bureaucracy has been allowed to prevail over common sense and reasonable judgment.

We, the undersigned feel strongly that the Prime Minister should intervene and instigate a review of the 2003 Act and begin proceedings to repeal the terms of this ill-thought out legislation.
